description:
Tuntun is very creative. She is thinking of a new way to modify the matrix but she is very weak in coding so help her to do so.
You are given a *n x m* integer matrix matrix, if an element is 0, set its entire row and column to 0's.

You must do it in place.

### Input Format
```

- The first line contains two space-separated integers ‘N’ and ‘M’, denoting the no. of the rows and columns of the matrix.

- The next 'N' lines will contain ‘M’ space separated integers representing the elements of the matrix.

```
### Output Format:
```
print the modified grid in a separate line.
```
### Example
```
1 1 1                  1 0 1
1 0 1     =>           0 0 0
1 1 1                  1 0 1
```
### Constraints:
```
- m == matrix.length
- n == matrix[0].length
- 1 <= m, n <= 200
- (-231) <= matrix[i][j] <= (231 - 1)
```
title: New Matrix

code_skeletons.skeleton_define_class:
class Solution:
    def solve(self, n, m, matrix):
